metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6432 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The SnifferDecompress function in wiretap/ngsniffer.c in the DOS Snifferfile parser in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.10 and 1.12.x before 1.12.1does not prevent data overwrites during copy operations, which allowsremote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via acrafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-6432` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwireshark11 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwiretap8 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
libwsutil9 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-4+deb8u11ubuntu0.14.04.1').
